FuncDef: This command creates a system-wide group (operational group) name which can be used to associate a number of service objects (for example, SAPs or pseudowires). The status of the group is derived from the status of its members. The status of the group can then be used to influence the status of non-member objects. For example, when a group status is marked as down, the object(s) that monitor the group change their status accordingly.

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the operational group identifier up to 32 characters in length.
This keyword is required when first creating the configuration context. Once the context is created, it is possible to navigate into the context without the create keyword.
